text:
Consider the following situation:

Everything is a tove, or a borogove, or a rath (exclusively), and there's at least one of each. Rafin chortled at Rafin. Every tove snicker-snacked every tove that snicker-snacked it. Only borogoves are beamish and every borogove is uffish. Not all toves snicker-snacked Zindle just in case no toves snicker-snacked Zindle. If a borogove snicker-snacked Rafin, then Bungo didn't snicker-snacked Bungo only if every rath chortled at Bungo.

Which, if any, of the following statements must be true in this situation?

1. Every tove snicker-snacked a tove.
2. A tove snicker-snacked every tove that snicker-snacked it.
3. Every tove snicker-snacked every tove.
4. No toves snicker-snacked every tove.
5. A tove snicker-snacked a tove.
6. A tove snicker-snacked every tove.

Consider the following situation:

Everything is a tove, or a borogove, or a rath (exclusively), and there's at least one of each. Zindle or Bungo will whiffle. Only toves will whiffle. Every rath chortled at Bungo. If Zindle will whiffle, then every rath is mimsy only if every borogove chortled at Bungo.

Which, if any, of the following statements must be true in this situation?

1. Zindle and Bungo will whiffle.
2. Every tove will whiffle.
3. Not all toves will whiffle.
4. A tove will whiffle.
5. No toves will whiffle.
6. Zindle will whiffle.

Consider the following situation:

Everything is a tove, or a borogove, or a rath (exclusively), and there's at least one of each. A tove chortled at every tove. No toves chortled at Rafin and no toves chortled at Bungo. A borogove chortled at Zindle just in case every rath snicker-snacked Bungo.

Which, if any, of the following statements must be true in this situation?

1. Bungo is a tove.
2. Zindle isn't a tove.
3. Rafin isn't a tove.
4. Rafin is a tove.
5. Zindle is a tove.

Consider the following situation:

Everything is a tove, or a borogove, or a rath (exclusively), and there's at least one of each. A tove snicker-snacked a tove that snicker-snacked a rath. Rafin chortled at every borogove. No toves chortled at Rafin but it is not the case that Rafin isn't a tove. Not all raths galumphed over Rafin and no toves chortled at Bungo. A tove galumphed over Rafin only if no toves snicker-snacked Zindle.

Which, if any, of the following statements must be true in this situation?

1. Zindle isn't a tove.
2. Bungo is a tove.
3. Zindle is a tove.
4. Rafin isn't a tove.
5. Rafin isn't a borogove.
6. Rafin is a borogove.

Consider the following situation:

Everything is a tove, or a borogove, or a rath (exclusively), and there's at least one of each. Rafin chortled at Bungo. Not all toves galumphed over Bungo. A rath snicker-snacked Zindle and every rath chortled at Zindle.

Which, if any, of the following statements must be true in this situation?

1. A rath snicker-snacked Zindle but it is not the case that Rafin didn't chortle at Bungo.
2. Zindle didn't snicker-snacked Bungo just in case no raths chortled at Rafin.
3. If Zindle didn't chortle at Rafin, then every rath snicker-snacked Bungo only if every rath chortled at Rafin.
4. Every rath snicker-snacked Zindle but it is not the case that Rafin didn't chortle at Bungo.
5. A rath snicker-snacked Zindle and Rafin didn't chortle at Bungo.
6. Every rath snicker-snacked Zindle and Rafin didn't chortle at Bungo.
